title: Atatiana Jefferson: 'Why I will no longer call the police'
description: When James Smith called police to check his neighbour was OK, she ended up dead. Never again, he says.

title: Garden villages locking-in car dependency, says report
description: A group promoting alternatives to the car said one garden village could be seven miles from a shop.

title: Coronavirus: Twelve weeks on I can't kick Covid exhaustion
description: More and more survivors of coronavirus are discovering its impact on their health is long-term.

title: Navajo Nation: The people battling America's worst coronavirus outbreak
description: The challenges of life in the Navajo Nation have made containing Covid-19 even more difficult.

title: Banjarmasin Diamond: Solving the mystery of the 'ugly, dirty' gem
description: The Banjarmasin Diamond was taken from an Indonesian sultan almost 200 years ago.

title: Coronavirus: 'My beach will survive', says Italian grandad
description: Italian beach resorts are gearing up for a Covid-secure 2020 season, which is welcome news for one owner.

title: Coronavirus: Emotional journey of transplant patient
description: Like many other transplant patients, Ana-Rose's hope for a new liver was put on hold due to Covid.

title: Instagram 'will overtake Twitter as a news source'
description: A report finds Instagram doubled its news audience last year - and could overtake Twitter by 2021.

title: 'People queued for an hour to enter' the shop
description: As the High Street opens for business, workers tell the BBC what it was like after weeks of lockdown.

title: Coronavirus: 'It's the worst news you can give as an employer'
description: Restaurateurs Peter and Elaine Kinsella discuss the challenges of letting staff go due to coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: ‘I’ve applied for more than 100 jobs’
description: Kayleigh Rennix is among thousands of people looking for work during the coronavirus crisis.

title: The lengths countries go to for a seat at UN top table
description: Canada, Norway and Ireland are in a tight race for two non-permanent seats on the security council.

title: Black Lives Matter: Have racial inequality reviews led to action?
description: A number of reviews have looked at race and equality over the years, but has the government taken action?

title: Coronavirus: The first thing I bought when the shops reopened
description: As stores across England selling non-essential goods opened their doors, we asked people in Milton Keynes what they bought.

title: 'It's not talked about': Female artists speak out about racism
description: Michelle Gayle, Fleur East, Sabrina from Mis-Teeq and Aluna Francis have all shared their experiences.

title: Royal Ascot 2020: Meeting ready to start without the Queen and spectators
description: No Queen, no spectators but plenty of action as Royal Ascot begins behind closed doors for the first time on Tuesday.

title: Coronavirus: Isle of Man becomes first in British Isles to live without lockdown
description: Many aspects of life on the island resume as it scraps social distancing rules.

title: Has a second wave of infections hit Iran?
description: Iran was one of the worst affected countries early on, so is the virus flaring up again?

title: Black Lives Matter: We need action on racism not more reports, says David Lammy
description: The Labour MP's comments come after the PM announced a new commission looking at racial inequality.

title: RAF Lakenheath: US fighter jet crashes into North Sea
description: A search is under way for the F-15C Eagle from RAF Lakenheath which crashed shortly after 09:40 BST.

title: Long queues as shops reopen in England after lockdown
description: Pent-up demand for some shops prompts queues outside stores around the country.

title: X Factor's Misha B claims show pushed 'angry black girl narrative' on her
description: The singer says the show "created this narrative of me being over confident because I'm black".

title: Whyte takes legal action against WBC after Fury-Joshua 'agreed'
description: Dillian Whyte takes legal action against the WBC after Tyson Fury-Anthony Joshua agree two-fight deal, Chris Eubank Jr takes a dig at Billy Joe Saunders, plus more in this week's Fight Talk.

title: Marcus Rashford calls for government free school meals U-turn
description: Manchester United and England's Marcus Rashford writes an open letter calling on the government to reverse a decision not to provide free school meal vouchers during the summer.

title: Man jailed for urinating at PC Keith Palmer memorial during protest
description: Andrew Banks had drunk 16 pints and was in central London to "protect statues", a court hears.

title: Pre-exam years back to meet teachers in secondary school
description: Some secondary pupils in England are back in school for catch-up classes and meetings with teachers.

title: Incredible 'lightning rainbows' illuminate UK skies
description: The rare combination was captured by BBC Weather Watchers during storms at the weekend.

title: EasyJet boss says full planes are 100% safe as flights resume
description: The comments come as the airline begins offering a limited numbers of flights on mainly domestic routes.

title: 'Falling is a part of life' - GB skateboarder Brown on training incident
description: Eleven-year-old British skateboarder Sky Brown wanted to show "falling is part of life" when she shared news of a horrific training incident earlier this month.

title: Williams would 'love to play' in US Open - coach Mouratoglou
description: Six-time US Open champion Serena Williams "would love to play" in New York, says her coach Patrick Mouratoglou.

title: Paul Whelan, ex-US marine, jailed in Russia on spying charges
description: Paul Whelan is sentenced to 16 years' hard labour 18 months after being arrested with a USB flash drive.

title: SNP MP Amy Callaghan suffers brain haemorrhage
description: The East Dunbartonshire MP has undergone neurosurgery after collapsing at her home.

title: Atlanta police shooting: Rayshard Brooks death declared homicide
description: Protests continue after the 27-year-old became the latest African American to be killed by police.

title: The Premier League season so far in eight graphics
description: With the Premier League returning, BBC Sport brings you up to speed on where we left off and where we might be heading over the next nine games.

title: Euros On This Day - 15 June: Van Basten hat-trick, Gascoigne's Wembley glory and Welbeck's cheeky finish
description: BBC Sport rounds up the best archive action from 15 June in European Championship history.

title: Coronavirus: France announces significant lifting of restrictions
description: President Emmanuel Macron proclaims that France has won its "first victory" against coronavirus.

title: 'I was in prison, now I'm training Jadon Sancho'
description: Mike Boateng wants his jail experience to help other young footballers avoid trouble.

title: London protests: 'We stopped somebody from being killed'
description: Patrick Hutchinson was pictured carrying a man to safety following a clash between demonstrators.
